meanings.definition: The state or quality of being feeble or weak.
meanings.sent1: Her feeblenesses made it hard for her to lift even the lightest objects.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted the feeblenesses in the patient's muscles during the examination.
meanings.sent3: Despite her feeblenesses, she tried to carry the heavy groceries into the house.
meanings.sent4: The feeblenesses of the old bridge were evident as it creaked under the weight of the passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The feeblenesses of the kitten's meows tugged at her heartstrings.

meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the patient's feeblenesses with the family members.
meanings.sent2: The feeblenesses of his voice showed his exhaustion after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The feeblenesses of the old man's grip on the cane made him look endearing.
meanings.sent4: The feeblenesses of the plant's stems were evident as they bent easily in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The feeblenesses of the puppy's barks were drowned out by the loud traffic outside.
